title: Simple Epidemic Spread Simulation
description: A simple simulation modeling the spread of a virus within a population of 1000 individuals using an agent-based approach.

interactions.name: encounter_and_transmission
interactions.description: When a susceptible person encounters an infected person, there is a probability of transmission.

metrics.name: susceptible_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Susceptible state over time.

metrics.name: infected_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Infected state over time.

metrics.name: recovered_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Recovered state over time.

metrics.name: cumulative_infections
metrics.description: Total number of individuals who have been infected at any point.

validation_criteria.name: sir_curve_shape
validation_criteria.description: The S, I, and R curves should exhibit typical epidemic dynamics (S decreases, I rises and falls, R increases).

validation_criteria.name: conservation_of_population
validation_criteria.description: The sum of Susceptible, Infected, and Recovered individuals should equal the initial population size at all times.

validation_criteria.name: epidemic_extinction
validation_criteria.description: The simulation should eventually reach a state where the infected count drops to zero (assuming recovery is possible).

validation_criteria.name: parameter_sensitivity
validation_criteria.description: Changes in parameters like transmission probability or initial infected count should lead to expected changes in the epidemic curves (e.g., higher transmission probability leads to faster spread and potentially higher peak).
